title: Mum transforms dated staircase for under £80 with budget buys from Ikea and B&Q
text:

A money-savvy mum-of-three has given the staircase at her house an insta-worthy revamp by spending less than £80 and doing the handiwork herself.

Sarah Lindsey, 37, of Perthshire, Scotland, sourced the materials from regular homeware stores and spent only £73.96 buying the white paint, four rugs and four lanterns for the transformation.

Sarah, a heart physiologist, said she looked for inspirations on Pinterest and Instagram before the renovation and believed she saved about £1,000 instead of hiring the professionals.

She told MailOnline : "When it came to the stairs, we initially thought to get a carpet company in but couldn't find anything we liked. The prices were so expensive too!

(Image: Sarah Lindsey)

"It's so important to do things yourself, and to have something homemade.

"All you need really is a staple gun and some rugs to get going. I must have saved about £1,000."

Sarah split the work over several days as she repainted the stairs using a £4 white paint from a B&Q sale before putting four £14.99 rugs she bought from The Range and decorating it with four £2.50 lanterns from Ikea.

She and her partner Conor are currently renovating their cottage they share with children Niamh, 11, Skye, 6, and Toren, 15 months.

(Image: Sarah Lindsey)

Her thrifty transformation has drawn appreciations on social media.

One wrote in the comment: "Sarah, the stairs look absolutely amazing!"

Another said: "It looks fab, love the lights, I think I need some more for our stairs!"
description: Sarah Lindsey, from Perthshire in Scotland, was praised on social media after spending several days refurbishing the staircase at home
